trans-unit.source: Create a clone of a Bitmap object from the coordinates and format specified

trans-unit.source: The width of the rectangle that specifies the portion of this bitmap to copy

trans-unit.source: [optional] Pixel format for the new bitmap:

seg-source.mrk: Pixel format for the new bitmap:

target.mrk: Pixel format for the new bitmap:

trans-unit.source: $GDIP_PXF16RGB555 = 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits for each RGB component

seg-source.mrk: $GDIP_PXF16RGB555 = 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits for each RGB component

target.mrk: $GDIP_PXF16RGB555 = 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits for each RGB component

trans-unit.source: $GDIP_PXF16RGB565 = 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits for red, 6 bits for green and 5 bits blue

seg-source.mrk: $GDIP_PXF16RGB565 = 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits for red, 6 bits for green and 5 bits blue

target.mrk: $GDIP_PXF16RGB565 = 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits for red, 6 bits for green and 5 bits blue

trans-unit.source: $GDIP_PXF16ARGB1555 = 16 bits per pixel; 1 bit for alpha and 5 bits for each RGB component

seg-source.mrk: $GDIP_PXF16ARGB1555 = 16 bits per pixel; 1 bit for alpha and 5 bits for each RGB component

target.mrk: $GDIP_PXF16ARGB1555 = 16 bits per pixel; 1 bit for alpha and 5 bits for each RGB component

trans-unit.source: $GDIP_PXF24RGB = 24 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB component

seg-source.mrk: $GDIP_PXF24RGB = 24 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB component

target.mrk: $GDIP_PXF24RGB = 24 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB component

trans-unit.source: $GDIP_PXF32RGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB component. No alpha component.

seg-source.mrk: $GDIP_PXF32RGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB component.

target.mrk: $GDIP_PXF32RGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB component.

trans-unit.source: $GDIP_PXF32ARGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB and alpha component

seg-source.mrk: $GDIP_PXF32ARGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB and alpha component

target.mrk: $GDIP_PXF32ARGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB and alpha component

trans-unit.source: $GDIP_PXF32PARGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB and alpha component, pre-multiplied

seg-source.mrk: $GDIP_PXF32PARGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB and alpha component, pre-multiplied

target.mrk: $GDIP_PXF32PARGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB and alpha component, pre-multiplied

trans-unit.source: $GDIP_PXF48RGB = 48 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB component

seg-source.mrk: $GDIP_PXF48RGB = 48 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB component

target.mrk: $GDIP_PXF48RGB = 48 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB component

trans-unit.source: $GDIP_PXF64ARGB = 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB and alpha component

seg-source.mrk: $GDIP_PXF64ARGB = 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB and alpha component

target.mrk: $GDIP_PXF64ARGB = 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB and alpha component

trans-unit.source: $GDIP_PXF64PARGB = 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB and alpha component, pre-multiplied

seg-source.mrk: $GDIP_PXF64PARGB = 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB and alpha component, pre-multiplied

target.mrk: $GDIP_PXF64PARGB = 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB and alpha component, pre-multiplied

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended may contain GPSTATUS error code ($GPID_ERR*).

trans-unit.source: When you are done with the Bitmap object, call _GDIPlus_BitmapDispose() to release the resources
